metadata.title: রুঙ্গুটমই | Rungutmoi | Rural Recipes
metadata.description:
Rungutmoi by Nirmal Rava & Sangeeta Rabha | রুরাল রেসিপির ছাব্বিশ তম পর্বে আলিপুরদুয়ারের রাভা জনজাতির নির্মল রাভা ও সঙ্গীতা রাভা বাড়ীর রান্না :   রুঙ্গুটমই

Rural local recipes are integral part of Intangible Cultural Heritage and needs to be preserved and promoted. We at banglanatak dot com have been working for the past 22+ years to safeguard and promote local cultural heritages in rural spaces across India.   We are now launching a new initiative of documenting rural recipes and bringing them closer to the food lovers of the world. We request all to subscribe to our new channel Rural Recipes and stay tuned there to know, learn and try out local delicacies.

Presenter:   Jamil Akhtar

transcription_bengali: [00:00:23] আমরা গ্রামবাসীদের নানা ধরনের খাবার সংগ্রহ করতে ঘুরে বেড়াচ্ছি।
[00:00:31] চিলাপাতা জঙ্গলের ভেতরে রাভা জনগোষ্ঠীর একটি গ্রামে যাব।
[00:01:02] আপনার বাড়ি একদম চিলাপাতা জঙ্গলের পাশেই।
[00:01:07] এখানে কি শুধু রাভা মানুষই থাকেন?
[00:01:13] আদিবাসীদের মধ্যে ‘ওরাও’ নামে একটা গ্রামও আছে।
[00:01:18] তাহলে জঙ্গলে অনেক রাভা মানুষ থাকেন?
[00:01:21] হ্যাঁ, জঙ্গলে সব রাভা মানুষই থাকেন।
[00:01:30] আমরা এই চ্যানেলের মাধ্যমে গ্রামবাসীদের নানা ধরনের খাবার তুলে ধরছি।
[00:01:37] আজ আপনি রাভা জনগোষ্ঠীর একটি ইউনিক পদ রান্না করবেন।
[00:01:57] এটা আমরা ‘খুদি চাল’ দিয়ে রান্না করব।
[00:02:09] এর সঙ্গে আর কিছু রান্না করবেন?
[00:02:27] তাহলে চলুন আজকের রান্না শুরু করি।
[00:02:57] তাহলে সিদল আর খুদি চাল দিয়ে রুঙ্গুটমই বানাব।
[00:04:26] আচ্ছা, এইটার মধ্যে রসুন বাটা দেবেন?
[00:04:43] আগেই অনেক রসুন দিয়েছি, তাই ঘ্রাণও ভালো আসছে।
[00:05:40] সিদল রাজবংশী হোক বা রাভা—দু’পক্ষেরই খুব প্রিয়।
[00:06:17] আর একটু সময় লাগবে, তাই তো?
[00:06:47] খুদি চাল দিয়ে রাভা ডাল/রুঙ্গুটমই তৈরি।
[00:07:34] সিদল আমাদের পূর্বপুরুষদের কাছ থেকে পাওয়া রেসিপি—
[00:08:20] আপনাদের আরও কী কী ট্র্যাডিশনাল পদ আছে?
[00:08:57] যখন ভাত খাওয়ার চাল থাকত না,
[00:09:41] এটাই আমাদের প্রাচীন/সবচেয়ে পুরোনো খাওয়ার পদ্ধতি।
transcription_english: [00:00:19] Hello, welcome to the Rural Recipe channel.
[00:00:23] We travel around to bring various village foods to you.
[00:00:27] We have reached the Chilapata forest.
[00:00:31] We will go inside Chilapata forest to a Rabha village.
[00:00:40] We can see Nirmal’s house in the distance—let’s go.
[00:00:52] Nirmal, how are you?
[00:00:54] Namaskar.
[00:00:57] Finally, we have come to your house.
[00:00:59] Today we have come to Khurmai village.
[00:01:02] Your house is right next to the Chilapata forest.
[00:01:07] Do only Rabha people live here?
[00:01:09] Yes, only Rabha people live here.
[00:01:13] There is also an Adivasi village called Orao.
[00:01:18] So there are many Rabha people in the forest area?
[00:01:21] Yes, Rabha people live in the forest area.
[00:01:26] You know about our channel.
[00:01:30] Through this channel we bring many kinds of village foods.
[00:01:37] Today you will cook a unique Rabha dish.
[00:01:43] What will you cook for us?
[00:01:45] We will cook Rungutmoi.
[00:01:50] Rungutmoi?
[00:01:57] We will cook it with khudi rice (broken rice/rice flour).
[00:01:58] We will show how to cook it.
[00:02:07] Namaskar, Sangeeta.
[00:02:09] Will you cook anything else with it?
[00:02:11] We will make Sidol Bharta with it.
[00:02:14] Sidol Bharta? Yes.
[00:02:27] Let’s start today’s cooking.
[00:02:34] Today we are cooking Rungutmoi—please tell the ingredients.
[00:02:41] We need rice flour/khudi rice, garlic, soda/khar (alkaline), green chilies, and salt.
[00:02:51] This is sidol (fermented dried fish).
[00:02:57] So we will cook Rungutmoi with sidol and khudi rice.
[00:03:09] Put the pot/pan on the stove (called ‘Tosol’ in Rabha).
[00:03:18] Add water first (called ‘Chika’ in Rabha).
[00:03:40] When the water boils, add chilies (called ‘Demchi’).
[00:03:58] Then add khudi rice.
[00:04:24] Add garlic paste.
[00:04:38] Then mash/grind (mortar and pestle mentioned); garlic aroma comes through.
[00:05:00] Add a little soda/khar, then add a little salt (called ‘Nishu Chepa’).
[00:05:40] Sidol is a favorite among both Rajbanshi and Rabha people.
[00:06:04] Cooking time: around 5–10 minutes (as discussed).
[00:06:11] Check if the rice is cooked; give it a little more time.
[00:06:24] The finished item is referred to as ‘Gerpa’ (as said).
[00:06:45] It is ready—Rungutmoi/Rabha dal with khudi rice.
[00:06:59] Now we will serve it with sidol.
[00:07:01] Wrap sidol in banana leaf and roast it on fire/stove for about 10 minutes.
[00:07:30] Banana-leaf roasted sidol is ready.
[00:07:44] Remove chilies, crush with garlic, add a little salt—sidol bharta/chutney is ready.
[00:08:20] They discuss other traditional foods, including dikiya saag (called kuching saag in Rabha), and how earlier they ate wild potatoes when rice was unavailable.
[00:09:48] Now they taste the food.
[00:10:01] This is sidol bharta; with it the rungutmoi tastes great—simple ingredients, strong garlic flavor.
[00:10:40] The episode ends with a request to subscribe, like, and comment. Thank you.
